Interface State

All Known Implementing Classes:
angryState, deadState, defaultState, hungryState, sleepState
public interface State
The State interface defines the behavioral contract for all mood-based states that a pet can be in (e.g., Sleep, Angry, Hungry, Dead). Each state can enable/disable commands and perform setup actions upon entering the state via enableState(). Implementing classes should override the methods to apply their specific logic to control pet behavior based on the current state.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Darsh Srikanth

  • Method Details

    • disableCommand

      void disableCommand(int command)
      Disables a specific command while in this state.
      Parameters:
      command - the integer value representing the command to disable

    • enableCommand

      void enableCommand(int command)
      Enables a specific command while in this state.
      Parameters:
      command - the integer value representing the command to enable

    • enableState

      void enableState()
      Applies logic specific to entering the current state. Typically includes setting up command availability and triggering any animations or effects.

    • getStateType

      int getStateType()
      Tells what number state the state is
      Returns:
      the integer value representing the state number
